Package controller

Class RestaurantController

java.lang.Object
controller.RestaurantController
public class RestaurantController extends Object
The RestaurantController class simulates the operation of a restaurant, handling customer flows, order processing, and managing various restaurant lists (queue, waiting, kitchen, served, etc.). It generates customers, processes orders, and updates the UI with real-time statistics.

    • queue

      public Queue<Integer> queue

  • Constructor Details

    • RestaurantController

      public RestaurantController(RestaurantView view)
      Initializes the restaurant controller with the given view.
      Parameters:
      view - The restaurant view for UI updates.

  • Method Details

    • startSimulationClock

      public void startSimulationClock()
      Starts the simulation clock and updates the UI with the elapsed time every second. Logs statistics at regular intervals into the database.

    • startSimulation

      public void startSimulation()
      Starts the simulation by generating customers and managing their flow through the restaurant. It spawns a new thread that handles the arrival of customers and ensures the simulation runs until all customers leave.

    • printStaticsWindow

      public void printStaticsWindow(int simulationID)
      Displays a window showing simulation statistics, including logs, customer timers, replay data, and list sizes for the given simulation ID. This method retrieves all relevant data from the database and presents it in a statistics window.
      Parameters:
      simulationID - The ID of the simulation whose statistics are to be displayed.

    • printLogsWindow

      public void printLogsWindow()
      Displays a window showing the logs for the simulation. This method retrieves all logs from the database and presents them in a dedicated window for review.

    • formatTime

      public String formatTime(long millis)
      Formats the given time in milliseconds into a human-readable string representation. If the time is less than 60 seconds, it will display the time in seconds. If the time exceeds 60 seconds, it will display the time in minutes and seconds.
      Parameters:
      millis - The time in milliseconds to format.
      Returns:
      A string representing the formatted time (e.g., "30 sec" or "2 min 15 sec").

    • getCustomerGenerationDuration

      public int getCustomerGenerationDuration()
      Retrieves and parses the customer generation duration from the view. This value determines how frequently new customers are generated. If the duration is valid, it will return the duration; otherwise, it returns 0 as a default value.
      Returns:
      The customer generation duration in seconds. If the duration is invalid, returns 0.
      Throws:
      NumberFormatException - If the value in the view cannot be parsed as an integer.

    • updateAvailableMachines

      public void updateAvailableMachines(int selectedMachines)
      Updates the number of available machines (or chefs, depending on context), and reinitializes the order queue with the new machine count. The method also triggers the process of handling the updated queue of orders.
      Parameters:
      selectedMachines - The number of machines (or chefs) selected for use in the system.

    • updateAvailableChefs

      public void updateAvailableChefs(int selectedChefs)
      Updates the number of available chefs and adjusts the order queue accordingly. This method also checks whether any orders are waiting in the queue and processes them with the newly available chefs.
      Parameters:
      selectedChefs - The number of chefs available to process orders.

    • getRoundedSize

      public int getRoundedSize(int size)
      Rounds the given size to the nearest multiple of 5. If the remainder when divided by 5 is 3 or greater, the size is rounded up to the next multiple of 5. If the remainder is less than 3, the size is rounded down to the previous multiple of 5.
      Parameters:
      size - The size to be rounded.
      Returns:
      The rounded size, which is a multiple of 5.

    • updateQueueLabel

      public void updateQueueLabel()
      Updates the queue label in the UI with the current queue size and average size. Also updates the individual customer labels in the queue. This method is run on the JavaFX Application Thread via Platform.runLater().

    • updateWaitingLabel

      public void updateWaitingLabel()
      Updates the waiting list label on the view, showing the number of customers in the waiting list along with the average waiting time. This method also manages the customer labels by adding new ones or updating existing labels. Additionally, it removes labels for customers who are no longer in the waiting list.

    • updateKitchenLabel

      public void updateKitchenLabel()
      Updates the kitchen list label on the view, showing the number of customers in the kitchen along with the average kitchen time. It manages customer labels by adding new ones, updating existing ones, and removing labels of customers who are no longer in the kitchen.

    • updateServedLabel

      public void updateServedLabel()
      Updates the served list label on the view, showing the number of customers who have been served along with the average service time. It handles adding new labels, updating existing labels, and removing labels for customers no longer in the served list.

    • updatePayListLabel

      public void updatePayListLabel()
      Updates the pay list label on the view, showing the number of customers in the payment queue along with the average payment time. It adds or updates customer labels and removes labels for customers no longer in the pay list.

    • updateLeftLabel

      public void updateLeftLabel()
      Updates the left list label on the view, showing the number of customers who left the restaurant along with the average time spent in the restaurant. It adds or updates customer labels and removes labels for customers no longer in the left list.

    • slideOutCustomer

      public void slideOutCustomer(javafx.scene.control.Label customerLabel, javafx.collections.ObservableList<javafx.scene.Node> queueBoxChildren)
      Slides out a customer's label from the queue box, simulating their departure. After the animation is finished, the label is removed from the view and from the customer labels map.
      Parameters:
      customerLabel - The label representing the customer to be removed.
      queueBoxChildren - The list of nodes in the queue box to remove the label from.

    • processWaitingList

      public void processWaitingList()
      Starts a background thread to process customers in the waiting list and move them to the kitchen. This simulates the preparation process based on available chefs.

    • getSimulationTime

      public int getSimulationTime()
      Gets the current simulation time.
      Returns:
      The simulation time in seconds.

    • getSimulationID

      public int getSimulationID()
      Gets the unique identifier for the current simulation.
      Returns:
      The simulation ID.

    • getQueue

      public Queue<Integer> getQueue()
      Gets the current queue of customers waiting to be processed.
      Returns:
      The queue of customers as a Queue of Integers.

    • getAvailableMachines

      public int getAvailableMachines()
      Gets the number of available machines for processing orders.
      Returns:
      The number of available machines.

    • getAvailableChefs

      public int getAvailableChefs()
      Gets the number of available chefs for processing orders.
      Returns:
      The number of available chefs.

    • getCustomerList

      public Map<Integer,Customer> getCustomerList()
      Gets the list of customers currently in the system.
      Returns:
      A map containing customer IDs as keys and Customer objects as values.

    • getCustomerTimersMap

      public Map<Integer,CustomerTimers> getCustomerTimersMap()
      Gets the map of customer timers in the system.
      Returns:
      A map containing customer IDs as keys and CustomerTimers objects as values.

    • getOrderQueue

      public OrderQueue getOrderQueue()
      Gets the current order queue.
      Returns:
      The OrderQueue object.

    • getKitchenList

      public Queue<Integer> getKitchenList()
      Gets the list of orders currently in the kitchen.
      Returns:
      The queue of orders in the kitchen as a Queue of Integers.

    • getWaitingList

      public Queue<Integer> getWaitingList()
      Gets the list of customers currently waiting for their orders to be processed.
      Returns:
      The queue of waiting customers as a Queue of Integers.

    • getServedList

      public Queue<Integer> getServedList()
      Gets the list of customers who have been served.
      Returns:
      The queue of served customers as a Queue of Integers.

    • getPayList

      public Queue<Integer> getPayList()
      Gets the list of customers who are paying for their orders.
      Returns:
      The queue of customers paying as a Queue of Integers.

    • getLeftList

      public Queue<Integer> getLeftList()
      Gets the list of customers who have left the system without completing the process.
      Returns:
      The queue of customers who left as a Queue of Integers.
